snippet: A malpractice case about the 2007 death of a young woman who had been treated at a Brooklyn emergency room raises troubling questions about the quality of care.
abstract: Editorial contends details surrounding 2007 death of young Brooklyn woman Sabrina Seelig at Wyckoff Heights Medical Center raise questions about the quality of care at the medical facility, despite the fact that a trial jury decided the hospital had not been negligent.
lead_paragraph: A malpractice case about the 2007 death of a young woman who had been treated at a Brooklyn emergency room raises troubling questions about the quality of care.
